content.description: Start in left facing corner. Get through the technical section then to the big jugs and flakes through the middle then knobs and reaches to anchor.
content.location: Land Between Wall. 3rd boltline to right of corner above The Herd, The Shepherd, and The Flock. Begins in a small left facing corner.

content.description: Start on an awkward muddy hill onto thin, sloppy crimps with somewhat insecure feet. Move right until you get up to a finger sized crack, then move left to the slope-y arete. The crux is getting over the ledge with only the slope-y arete and extremely thin mossy holds. Trust your feet and sense of balance, and this should be a cake walk.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Standard two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Just around the corner of "The Flock" (10b/c) (on the right of The Flock). The first route in the corner starting from the left. Your belayer may have to stand on an awkward muddy hill surrounded by a tree and bushes.

content.description: Begin at right side of low cave. Pull through finger cracks to a technical and slopey 1st and 2nd bolt, then up to ledge. Take a breather, cause that's the only one you'll get. Head up the vertical face using small pockety edges.
content.location: The center bolt line on this face. Begins on right side of low cave.

content.description: This route is farthest left on the Land Between the Wall. Use the arête and stem off of a right facing block moving over the arête to establish yourself on the face. Using thin sloper crimps, clamber up to a large slotted opening with juggy features until moving right and reestablishing the face up to the anchors.
Start right next to a tree and bust out the slopey crux to easier fun climbing up top. Full value grade if you don't chimney on the tree.
content.location: Land Between wall. To the right of the Shepherd.

content.description: AM sun. Nice collection of 5.10-11 routes just past Tea and Crumpets wall. Usually uncrowded.
